turn.text: Two fact statements.
First of all... and if the Court would wish, I will send them a copy.
Apparently the receiver intends to file a motion to terminate the receivership next week.
He no longer has the money to pay for his bond.
If you wish, I will supply a copy of that to the Court.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Burger
turn.text: The Court should be provided with a copy.

turn.speaker: e_dennis_muchnicki
turn.label: Mr. E. Dennis Muchnicki
turn.text: He simply has nothing left, and he can't even pay for his receivership bond anymore.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice White
turn.text: He wants discharge, then.

turn.speaker: e_dennis_muchnicki
turn.label: Mr. E. Dennis Muchnicki
turn.text: Yes.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice White
turn.text: What's he going to do with the property?

turn.speaker: e_dennis_muchnicki
turn.label: Mr. E. Dennis Muchnicki
turn.text: The property will revert, I would assume, to Mr. Kovacs because here is the--

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Burger
turn.text: Or to the trustee in bankruptcy.

turn.speaker: e_dennis_muchnicki
turn.label: Mr. E. Dennis Muchnicki
turn.text: --Well, here is the status of the property.
The property... the Chem-Dyne is owned by Hierco Realty, which is a partnership; it was part of the bankruptcy.
The partners of Hierco Realty are Mr. Kovacs and the Chem-Dyne Corporation which is not in the bankruptcy.
The net effect is that neither the bankruptcy trustee nor the State court receiver could figure out who owned the property or who had it, but the bankruptcy trustee said he didn't want it.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice White
turn.text: Who owns Chem-Dyne?

turn.speaker: e_dennis_muchnicki
turn.label: Mr. E. Dennis Muchnicki
turn.text: The Chem-Dyne Corporation, all the stock is owned by Kovacs, but the stock--

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice White
turn.text: It shouldn't have been too hard to figure out who owned the property.

turn.speaker: e_dennis_muchnicki
turn.label: Mr. E. Dennis Muchnicki
turn.text: --I think on that suggestion, that would certainly show where it is.
Also, as to whether there was a turnover action, in fact, the bankruptcy trustee did file a turnover action--

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice White
turn.text: What happened?

turn.speaker: e_dennis_muchnicki
turn.label: Mr. E. Dennis Muchnicki
turn.text: --against the receiver, and the receiver had to turn over the most important thing, being like the tank trucks and the pumps and the things that he was using to do the cleanup.

turn.speaker: john_paul_stevens
turn.label: Justice Stevens
turn.text: Now, are these facts in the record that was before the Court of Appeals?

turn.speaker: e_dennis_muchnicki
turn.label: Mr. E. Dennis Muchnicki
turn.text: No, that was not in the record.
That happened after.

turn.speaker: john_paul_stevens
turn.label: Justice Stevens
turn.text: Should we not decide the case on the same record they did?

turn.speaker: e_dennis_muchnicki
turn.label: Mr. E. Dennis Muchnicki
turn.text: Well, I was simply responding to the factual question that was raised.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice White
turn.text: I know, but the inference was previously given that the property would revert, and I just couldn't see... understand that.
That's all.

turn.speaker: e_dennis_muchnicki
turn.label: Mr. E. Dennis Muchnicki
turn.text: Well, it would be my understanding, what the receiver apparently intends to do is to file a motion to dissolve it, and at that point the property will go back to Mr. Kovacs.
But I will provide the Court with whatever--

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Burger
turn.text: Whatever factual information you provide, it would be more helpful to the Court if it's provided as an agreed statement of what the facts are.
Whether it's relevant to the decision of this case remains to be seen.

turn.speaker: e_dennis_muchnicki
turn.label: Mr. E. Dennis Muchnicki
turn.text: --Thank you, Your Honor.
We'll attempt to do that.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: Thank you, counsel.
The case is submitted.
